comment: An amazing teacher! Read the books and attend class and you should get an A. He is very helpful, and if you have any questions he makes sure that he answers it in a way you understand. He's also pretty hot, so there's that.
Do the small readings and he loves class discussion. A couple small papers and one big one which are not exactly easy. Prof kinda nerdy but so cute! Interesting class.

Dr. McGinnis is a wonderful professor! He is very passionate about philosophy and he knows his stuff. No textbook, but you do have to buy a couple of ten dollar books here and there. He also puts about half of the readings online. As long as you come to class and read the material, getting an A is easy!
Great teacher, very easy. He doesn't use a textbook and all his grades come from readings. Pay attention and read and you can get an easy A.
The Professor is great, the class is hard but only because it is Philosophy. He explains everything pretty well, and is willing to help anyone. I would recommend this professor for anyone.
This professor is a darling. He's handsome, enthusiastic, oh, and quite intelligent. READ. THINK. That's what he wants you to do. And what you ought to want to do too. Excellent class.

Honestly, I never studied..looked everything up on sparknotes..wrote a 5 page paper (that was supposed to be 10) and I still made a B. He's nice to look at but explains things for 30 minutes. I would NOT take it again..philosophy was a rough subject.
I would not take this class again. Its not because of the teacher.. He is pretty funny and knows what he is talking about. The subject is just really boring.

The subject is the hardest thing about this class. Philosophy is NOT easy. But he really explains well. Be sure to read. You don't have to buy the textbook bc he lets you print everything offline. He's cute too, kinda looks like Harry Potter. And really nice. I recommend.

This guy comes off cold in the beginning, but once he warms up to the class he is great. He's a funny guy, knows what he's talking about, and is willing to help. He always comments on papers effectivly. PAPERS ARE HARD but not because he makes them difficult. The material is tough so that is the only problem in this class. Just pay attention.

The subject itself is very boring. I took this class Spring '08 and at the end, I didn't learn anything. I wrote jargon in the tests but ended up with a C. He is very helpful if you want to be helped.
